reviews.review_msg: Though the course readings were interesting and diverse, topic-wise, her lectures oftentimes focused more heavily on specific topics of interest to her, like security and especially the military. Marking was kind of inconsistent, probably because she's a new prof. The exam was very lengthy, but doable, and heavily based on readings.

He comes off as very young and naive. He's very approachable, but he also seems quite wimpy, like a kid who is just learning how to act like an adult. He barely gave lectures at all, everything was led by class discussion which of course he could barely control or moderate. Still, he was easy at least.

Disgusting. This man is completely unengaging. He blithers away until everyone is hating life. Readings are never ending and uninspiring.  This man ought to take EDUC 100 before attempting to take on a class of his own.

Linda cares, she gives detailed and helpful feedback. Course outlines are well organized. Though she herself can be disorganized, she does grant extensions for about every assignment. The only thing is that she gives a lot of work: heavy readings, lots of small assignments, etc. But if you can handle it, she makes you a better writer and student.

Dr. Ross speaks clearly and can effectively communicate most concepts to students. His lecture style was relatively engaging and the material he presented was on the whole interesting. I would take another class with him.
obviously cares very little about his students.  Does not stick to lession plans nor does he prepare lectures in advance.  This leads to a useless waste of two hours of babbling nonesence.
Very knowledgable and interesting, knows and likes lots of technical details

Dr. Prest is nice to his students but as a professor he is sub-par. He asks open ended questions to the class frequently and will stand awkwardly for as long as it takes for someone to respond - only to reply with an "mhm." His feedback is useful but he is the slowest marker I've ever experienced. He teaches POL347 like it was a 100 level course.

Even though I had no prior interest in CFP, I really enjoyed this course. Stewart was able to create a positive learning environment by facilitating respectful discussions, conveying complex material in a manner that is accessible + by being responsive to suggestions. Ive only taken 1 course with him, but hes my fav prof in the dept. so far!

Very hard marker in regard to essay writing. Make sure to always cite, even when you don't think you should...you will learn the hard way. Personality makes you not want to participate in class, makes you feel inferior. Wouldn't take this prof again, sometimes you have no choice though! Make sure to do your readings for the quizzes.
Jérémie is a real one! Can be stern but overall was a great prof! Great fits and very detailed explanation. Also an environmentalist so he gets extra points in my books.

Never wants to listen to what students have to say, if you're on the other side of his opinion. Always out to get people for their quality of French and similarities to other online sources (he'll yell at you in his office is there's even a similarity to another source). Beware taking his classes.
